mods.abstract: TWENTY-FIVE DOLLARS REWARD. The above reward will be paid for the delivery to me at my plantation on the Bayou Black, or in any jail where I can get him, of the boy ARTHUR, 22 years old, 5 feet 6 or 7 inches high, stout built, broad shoulders, has a small scar on his forehead, sound white teeth, does not use tobacco, has wide hollow feet, long toes, wears shoes of No. 10, is of a dark brown complexion, and quite likely. Will deny his owner's name, in the hope of being sold out of jail to some one living near the city. T.S. EASTON, Bayou Black, Reference to William G. Hewes, Carondelet street, New Orleans. jy6 3t

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
